doc.after: Of the mostly small, nocturnal lemurs in family Cheirogaleidae, the genus Phaner contains some of the largest species, along with Cheirogaleus.[6] Their body weight ranges between 350 and 500Â g (0.77 and 1.10Â lb),[27] and their head-body length averages between 23.7 and 27.2Â cm (9.3 and 10.7Â in), with a tail length between 31.9 and 40.1Â cm (12.6 and 15.8Â in).[28]
